executiveSummary: Entrepreneurs Adam Kalan and Matt Campbell pitched BottleKeeper, an insulated stainless steel container that keeps bottled beer cold and protected. They requested a $1 million investment for 5% equity, valuing the company at $20 million. After extensive negotiations, they accepted a joint offer from Lori Greiner and Mark Cuban for $1 million in exchange for 5% equity and a $1.50 per-unit royalty until the investors recoup $1.5 million.
keyDecisions: Lori Greiner and Mark Cuban invested $1 million for 5% equity with a $1.50 per-unit royalty until they earn back $1.5 million.

actionItems.task: Collaborate with Lori Greiner and Mark Cuban to expand BottleKeeper’s retail and marketing reach.
Implement strategic planning to manage marketing spend and IP protection costs.

nextSteps: Adam and Matt will work with Lori and Mark to scale BottleKeeper’s operations, enter retail stores, and optimize profitability while maintaining brand durability.
